item.title: Tysons Corner Gets Wireless Network Connections
item.description: Washington D.C., a major hub for technology in government, military, and business, has been a key market for XO Communication’s competitive network services. Their newest offering is high-capacity broadband wireless for the Tysons Corner area of Virginia, with speeds ranging from 10 Mbps to 1 Gbps for various services including VoIP, Ethernet, and private lines. This surpasses WiFi capabilities, offering speeds from 10 Mbps to 1 Gbps, exceeding what’s available through standard consumer wireless options like WiFi and WiMAX.

item.title: Advantages of a Wireless Business Continuity Plan
item.description: For businesses today, the difference between success and failure often comes down to a reliable internet connection. In the past, while important, telecom connections weren’t critical for daily operations. Now, with businesses relying on cloud-based applications and data storage, a lost connection can bring everything to a halt. While wired connections are generally dependable, they aren’t perfect. Downtime, whether due to equipment malfunctions or accidental cable cuts, can lead to significant financial setbacks.

item.title: ElephantDrive Never Forgets Your Files
item.description: Elephants are known for their impressive memory. What if you could harness that power for your data? ElephantDrive is an online storage service that offers the digital equivalent of an elephant’s memory. ElephantDrive provides unlimited, encrypted storage that’s easily accessible and budget-friendly for individuals and businesses. Think of it as storage in the cloud. This offsite backup ensures your data’s safety, even if disaster strikes your primary location. Imagine losing your computer and backups to a tornado.

item.title: TelePacific Takes Business Continuity Seriously
item.description: TelePacific Communications, a telecommunications company serving California and Nevada, emphasizes a thorough approach to disaster preparedness and business continuity. Their Business Continuity Services aim to keep your voice and data operational, even if a trunk line or your entire facility goes down. But how is this achieved? Let’s start with telephone service. Many businesses utilize digital trunk lines like T1 PRI and SIP Trunks, which offer cost savings compared to individual lines but pose a single point of failure risk.
